pullRequest.title: Handle Client Reset in a separate callback
pullRequest.bodyText:
Closes #6731
Since Client Reset is going to be more prominent again with the proposed changes to how we handle new datatypes at the sync protocol level, it would beneficial to explicitly handle this case. This also means developers don't have to do an awkward instance check and cast for Client Reset.

commit.message: Handle Client Reset in a seperate interface

nodes.bodyText: Is this the default behaviour we want to introduce rather than throwing? what happens now if the user silently ignores this error? sync will stop or we'll keep getting a divergent history error from the server?
Is the code snippet pointed to from the doc is up-to-date?
Is there a test checking we could actually open the backup correctly and inspect data?
